work.name: Division of Libraries, New York University
work.summary: Creating workflows and resources for using IIIF standards, IIIF-compatible content, and creating new IIIF materials by surveying potential users and implementers.

work.name: Center for Latin American and Caribbean Studies, New York University
work.summary: Led the first major effort to catalog the CLACS Quechua Library, ultimately resulting in the creation of Runakunaq Bibliotecanku (see Projects). Additionally, assisted with departmental events through promotion and administrative support.

work.name: Epicenter NYC
work.summary: Contributed to the weekly newsletter with Quechua language learnings. Reported for citywide COVID-19 and MPV grant, including social media outreach, community programming, and vaccination efforts. Additionally, managed the schedule for the CEO/Founder, Mitra Kalita.

projects.name: Runakunaq Bibliotecanku
projects.summary: An in-progress, open-access library and research hub for Andean studies, Quechua language, and worldwide Indigenous studies

projects.name: IIIF Guides - NYU
projects.summary: Creating guides and resources to expand IIIF (International Image Interoperability Framework) awareness and use at NYU.

projects.name: Chile 1973/2023
projects.summary: Created website for events happening around New York City to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the U.S.-backed military coup in Chile.

courses: Critical Voices in Sustainability and Environmental Justice

awards.title: Foreign Language and Area Studies Fellowship - Quechua
awards.summary: FLAS Fellowships provide allocations of academic year and summer fellowships to institutions of higher education to assist meritorious graduate students undergoing training in modern foreign languages and related area or international studies.

awards.title: Dália Leonardo Student Award
awards.summary: In honor of Leonardo's lifelong contributions to the field, LACUNY has created the Dália Leonardo Library School Scholarship for students who show interest in description, digitization, and organizaiton.

awards.title: Sapir Award for Research in Anthropology and Linguistics
awards.awarder: NYU Department of Anthropology and Linguistics
awards.summary: The Edward Sapir Prize is given once a year to an outstanding senior with a joint major in Linguistics and Anthropology.
